Ask HN: Alternative to Skype/Viber etc. which doesn't sleep?
text:
Is there a decent alternative to Skype/Viber etc. which doesn't sleep on a tablet (iPad in this case?)

The issue I'm having is that I use Skype to communicate with my 80 year old parents. When I call them on Skype it very rarely rings, and you need to call them on the landline first.

I'd originally thought this was because of the extremely old tablet or wifi-router, but, both of those have been upgraded and the problem persists. I'm pretty sure it's just that the device is going into some kind of sleep and not notifying about an incoming call. I have tried allowing notifications, turning off "do not disturb" etc.

Has anyone found a way around this kind of issue? Am I just doing something wrong? Is there a better app to use for calling which doesn't have this kind of problem? Ideally I'd just like Skype to ring properly whenever the tablet is rung.

Ask HN: How to show a not “so perfect” MVP to potential customers?
text:
Hello.

I know that MVP is not about the finished product, but you need at least to show some reliable experience to potential customers.

I have an MVP in the AI field, but in order to have accuracy and a fully satisfactory experience, it requires some conditions, because it deals with random variables that I still don't have full control over (i.e: I need people to speak with good diction/utterance).

How can I present this to potential customers so "random variables" wouldn't discredit my product?

Ask HN: Btrfs VS ZFS for Linux personal computer in 2022?
text:
Which of these filesystems should I go with today if I want to ensure being able to recover from failures and also not have poor performance? Which one is most mature today? Which one doesn't require too many magical incantations to be able to recover files and do common maintenance?

In short: What filesystem of these should I go with today if I want to have the best and easiest user experience?
